DWWSWAGTD: Do What We Say We Are Going To Do
ARPU: Average Revenue Per User. Represents the total subscription revenue and transaction-based revenue of the Company in the period divided by the number of Customer Locations of the Company in the period. For greater clarity, the number of Customer Locations of the Company in the period is calculated by taking the average number of Customer Locations throughout the period.
LTV: Life Time Value. This is how much money we get from customers throughout their life time.
CAC: Customer Acquisition Cost. This is the upfront cost we need to pay to acquire a customer. Usually includes marketing cost, sale cost, infrastructure to host the customers trial.
GAP: Global Assets Package. A repository used for storing global Front-end assets, which can be imported and used in different unrelated projects.
EBITDA: Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation, and Amortization. EBITDA, as adjusted for share-based compensation and related payroll taxes, compensation expenses relating to acquisitions completed, foreign exchange gains and losses, transaction-related costs, restructuring and litigation provisions.
LTM: Last Twelve Months - used a lot in finance
UAT: User Acceptance Testing - a form of UX testing that involves real users testing and QAing the website/app and reporting bugs.
GMV: Gross Merchandise Value: is the total value of merchandise sold over a given period of time through a customer-to-customer (C2C) exchange site. It is a measure of the growth of the business or use of the site to sell merchandise owned by others.
GTM: Go To Market - Umbrella term for our Sales teams (SDR, BD, AM, SalesOps, Customer Engagement, SE, Mid-Market,..) + the Marketing Team
SE: Sales Enablement - This technically minded department serves to help the Sales department in pushing a sale along toward a signed contract. It was formerly known as 'Sales Engineering'.
Sales Ops: Sales Operations Specialists - This team handles review of sales, payments, billing, and hardware shipment
CGS: Customer Growth [Specialists] - This team no longer exists, however they worked with existing clients to nurture them and inform them of potential upsells
AM: Account Management - This team takes over a customer 14 days after a sale is made. Fed or helped by CGS, they renew, and upsell this customer going forward
P&C: As of 2020, the HR (Human Resources) department is known as 'P&C' (People and Culture)
IS: Information Systems - Commonly called 'internal systems' as well, this team is the main go-to for our CRM (Salesforce), among others.
P&C: People & Culture - The team name for Human Resources (HR)
DG: Demand Generation Representative - Alternate (old) name for SDR (Sales Development Representative)
SDR: Sales Development Representatives - Alternate (new) name for DG (Demand Generation Representative)
BD/AE: Business Development Representative / Account Executive - Soon to be replaced with AE, Account Executive
PDM: Partner Development Manager - In charge of seeking out new reseller or referral partner business
PGM: Partner Growth Manager - In charge of managing and growing existing reseller and referral partner business
OBC: Onboarding Coordinator - This person schedules and coordinates webinars and onboarding sessions for the PS (Product Specialists)
CSM: Customer Success Manager - This person handles escalations, requests for compensation and requests for references
PS: Product Specialist - This specialist trains and onboards new customers
CGS: Customer Growth Specialists - Legacy role that doesn't exist anymore.
PBP: People Business Partner - This person interfaces with a specific department within the company as their 'go-to' point of contact for recruitment, issues and advice. They are members of the P&C team.
FSS: Field Support Specialists - These specialists help to go on site to install the system for customer
BC: Business Consultant - Legacy role in NoAm only, taking care of customers for their first 6 months after BD handover. After 6 months, going to AM. (Doesn't exist anymore in FY22)
AE: Account Executive - Former BD, closes the sale
MCP: Model Context Protocol â€“ is an open standard developed by Anthropic to standardize how AI models like Large Language Models (LLMs) access and utilize context from external tools and data sources.
CW: Closed Won - A sale that has been won and closed by the Account Executive
BR: Bogus Rate - The % of rejected leads due to bogus contact information
QR: Qualification Rate - The % of MQL leads that convert into SQLs
CR: Close Rates - the % of SQLs that convert into CWs
AR: Absolute Rates - the % of MQLs that convert into CWs
